stories.title: GOP Underdog Rick Santorum Tweets About #Iowasurprise
stories.title_clean: GOP Underdog Rick Santorum Tweets About #Iowasurprise
stories.summary: GOP presidential underdog Rick Santorum has tripled his share of the vote in Iowa, just days out from polling on January 3.
stories.extended_summary: The Pennsylvania senator’s late surge to third place at 16 per cent came after he secured the endorsement of the conservative group the ‘Family Leader’ and also took aim at one of the major contenders Ron Paul. Santorum, who is peaking at just the right time, claimed in the video above that he felt “very good” about his 11th hour rise. Republicans such as Mike Huckabee and Sarah Palin have talked positively about the Santorum candidacy, as he bids to shore up the conservative base.

contacts.name: The Iowa Republican
contacts.notes: News for Republicans by Republicans. Footage is cleared with credit.

stories.title: Rebekah Brooks's Friday
stories.title_clean: Rebekah Brooks's Friday
stories.summary: For the day that’s in it, here’s the latest parody of Rebecca Black’s Friday, starring the News of the World hacking scandal and “sung” by former News International chief executive Rebekah Brooks.

stories.title: WSJ - Conflict Threatens Cultural Heritage in Syria and Iraq - Various
stories.title_clean: Conflict Threatens Cultural Heritage in Syria and Iraq
stories.summary:
Violent confrontations between various armed groups in war-torn parts of Syria and Iraq continue to pose a significant threat to ancient cultural, historic and religious sites in some of oldest cities in the Middle East and the world.

The Islamic State (IS, formerly ISIS/ISIL) have adopted a practice of destroying Islamic shrines around Iraq, claiming that they constitute “idolatry”.
stories.extended_summary:
IS often document these practices themselves, such as the case of the bombing of the 11th century Ima Dur shrine, which can be seen here.

IS also featured demolitions of shrines and tombs in Nineveh Province in Dabiq, its online English-language magazine. Their operations against “idoltary” (shirk) can be seen from page 15 here.

stories.title: PARIS SHOOTING - ARCHIVE Charlie Hebdo Firebombed Over Mohammed Cartoon
stories.title_clean: ARCHIVE Charlie Hebdo Firebombed Over Mohammed Cartoon
stories.summary: Archive – November 2nd 2011 The offices of ‘Charlie Hebdo’ have been firebombed after the French satirical magazine published an edition on the Arab Spring ‘guest-edited’ by the Prophet Mohammed. The magazine, which is fiercely anti-clerical, provoked the ire of many Muslims in 2007 after it reprinted cartoons of the prophet – originally carried by Danish newspaper Jyllands-Posten – which caused outrage.
stories.extended_summary: The special edition, renamed ‘Charia Hebdo’ (Sharia Hebdo), poked fun at the Arab Spring. The magazine’s website was also hacked, with Islamic messages posted online.

stories.title: TEST - [NO REPLY] Testing This
stories.title_clean: Testing This
stories.clearance_text: We have contacted the uploader of this content to ascertain usage rights. We will update this entry once we have more information.

stories.title: ISLAMIC STATE - [PUBLIC] Islamic State Propaganda Video Shows Efforts at Winning Support in Mayadeen - November 05
stories.title_clean: Islamic State Propaganda Video Shows Efforts at Winning Support in Mayadeen
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit. {{credit}}
stories.summary: A new video released on November 5 by Wilayat al-Khair, the Deir Ezzor media arm of the Islamic State, shows how the jihadist group is propagandising in the region. The video shows leaflets being handed out to residents at an information kiosk, and shows how locals are being shown graphic Islamic State propaganda footage at public screenings. Many of those being shown the footage are children.

stories.title: SYRIA - [PUBLIC] Civil Defense Unit Responds to Shelling of Islamic State in Al Bab - November 18
stories.title_clean: Civil Defense Unit Responds to Shelling of Islamic State in Al Bab
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided (by an NGO/activist/public body) for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit. {{credit}}
stories.summary: Activists based in Al Bab, Aleppo, report that at least 20 people were killed and 65 injured when regime aircraft dropped barrel bombs on a restaurant and bakery in the town late on November 17. The activists report that the majority of those killed were members of Islamic State; they also report that some the identities of some of the casualties could not be confirmed.
stories.extended_summary:
A stringer from Al Bab known to Storyful (and who now lives in Turkey) said that Islamic State members were among the dead. The “fast-food restaurant” targeted in the attack “is in front of the square where usually [Islamic State are] hanging people after killing them,” he said. Two barrel bombs were dropped by helicopters, one on a bakery and one on the restaurant. At least eight civilians were killed, he said.

Video uploaded to the YouTube account of a civil defense unit based in Al Bab shows members responding to what appears to be a restaurant. No bodies of casualties are visible in the video.

contacts.name: Al Bab Local Coordinating Committee
contacts.notes: Also uses videos from this account: http://www.youtube.com/user/AlbabCityShbab/videos

stories.title: US - [PUBLIC] Video Shows What It's Like for a Paratrooper to Jump Out of a Plane - November 13
stories.title_clean: Video Shows What It's Like for a Paratrooper to Jump Out of a Plane
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided (by an NGO/activist/public body) for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit. {{credit}}
stories.summary: Every wonder what it’s like for a paratrooper in the US military to jump out of a plane? The United States Department of Defense released a video on November 13 of a paratrooper jumping during a training exercise. The paratrooper attached a camera to himself for the exercise. This video shows the soldier’s perspective as he jumps out of the plane and floats to the ground.

stories.title: SPACE - [PUBLIC] ESA Manager Jokes That Philae Landed Twice on Comet - November 13
stories.title_clean: ESA Manager Jokes That Philae Landed Twice on Comet
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided (by an NGO/activist/public body) for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit. {{credit}}
stories.summary: The European Space Agency (ESA) released a video on November 13 sharing details of Philae’s soft landing on comet 67P as well as the first image of the comet’s surface. As Philae touched down, it actually lifted off again before landing for a second time. The ESA stated this was designed to handle the impact of landing, with Stephan Ulamec, Philae lander manager, joking that Philae had in fact landed on the comet twice.

contacts.name: ESA
contacts.location: France, Paris, Rome, Madrid, Darmstadt, Noordwijk, Cologne, Kourou

stories.title: EGYPT - [CONTACT] Cairo Metro Explosion Causes Stampede - November 13
stories.title_clean: Cairo Metro Explosion Causes Stampede
stories.clearance_text: We have contacted the uploader of this content to ascertain usage rights. Contact details for the uploader are provided should you wish to contact them directly. We will amend this entry once we have more information.
stories.summary: An explosion on a metro train in Cairo on November 13 led to a panicked stampede that left 16 people injured, according to local reports citing health ministry sources. The explosion reportedly took place at the Helmeyet el-Zayto metro station, and the injured were taken to nearby hospitals for treatment. AFP reported that an explosion on a train north of Cairo killed four people in recent days.
stories.stated_location: Saray El Kobba Metro Station, Cairo

stories.title: SPACE - [PUBLIC] Philae Lander Sends Signals From Comet Surface - November 12
stories.title_clean: Philae Lander Sends Signals From Comet Surface
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit. {{credit}}
stories.summary: The Philae spacecraft landed on comet 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko on November 12, becoming the first spacecraft ever to land on a comet. The European Space Agency (ESA), which is spearheading the mission, said that Philae “is talking to us”, shortly after the landing was announced.

contacts.name: ESA
contacts.location: France, Paris, Rome, Madrid, Darmstadt, Noordwijk, Cologne, Kourou

stories.title: BOSTON - [EMBED] Boston Bombing Survivor Throws Farewell Party for Her Leg Before Its Amputation - November 10
stories.title_clean: Boston Bombing Survivor Throws Farewell Party for Her Leg Before Its Amputation
stories.clearance_text: Clients can embed the posts, images and videos in their original form. Embed only. Storyful does not have permissions for downloads and moving any elements within off platform.
stories.summary: Rebekah DiMartino, a mother and now newlywed, was at the finish line of the Boston Marathon on April 15, 2013, when a bomb went off and severely injured her left leg. The 27-year-old underwent 17 operations to try and salvage her limb, but ultimately decided on amputating it. She went under the knife on Monday, November 10.
stories.extended_summary:
The surgery, performed at Memorial Hermann Katy Hospital outside Houston, was reportedly a success.

Prior to the operation, to bid farewell to her left leg, DiMartino threw a “Last Supper” party surrounded by friends and family in Texas. She captured the moments leading up to her surgery on social media.

stories.title: ISLAMIC STATE - [PUBLIC] Iraq's Displaced People Face Harsh Winter - November 09
stories.title_clean: Iraq's Displaced People Face Harsh Winter
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided (by an NGO/activist/public body) for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit. {{credit}}
stories.summary: More than 1.8 million people were displaced from their homes in 2014 due to the ongoing conflict in northern Iraq, according to UNICEF Iraq. In July, UNICEF reported that up to 750,000 children were among those affected. Now, as winter approaches, those people face harsh conditions while living in temporary accommodation. This video shows UNICEF staff distributing warm winter clothes in northern Iraq.

stories.title: ITALY - [LICENSED] Two Waterspouts Form Off Ligurian Coast - November 06
stories.title_clean: Two Waterspouts Form Off Ligurian Coast
stories.clearance_text:

Clients must use the download button under the videos and provide an on-screen credit to the uploader. 

MRSS clients will receive this video via MRSS. Please see emails with the published link.

stories.summary: Two waterspouts formed simultaneously off the coast of western Liguria, Italy, on November 6, as a thunderstorm moved through the area. Both dissipated before reaching land. The waterspouts were viewable from Diana Marina, Cervo and Andora, according to a local report. This footage was recorded from Diana Marina.

stories.title: ANIMALS - [PUBLIC] Los Angeles Zoo Staff Surprised by Birth of Baby Hippopotamus - November 04
stories.title_clean: Los Angeles Zoo Staff Surprised by Birth of Baby Hippopotamus
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided (by an NGO/activist/public body) for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit. {{credit}}
stories.summary: The staff at the Los Angeles Zoo got a Halloween trick when a hippopotamus gave birth to a calf on October 31. The calf’s mother, Mara, was on birth control, the Los Angeles Times reported. The baby’s sex hasn’t been determined yet nor has it been named, the Times reported. It’s the first hippopotamus to be born at the Los Angeles Zoo in 26 years, the zoo said.

stories.title: HAWAII - [PUBLIC] Puna Lava Flow Pauses - November 03
stories.title_clean: Puna Lava Flow Pauses
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided (by an NGO/activist/public body) for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit. {{credit}}
stories.summary: The forward flow of lava from Hawaii’s Kilauea volcano has been paused since October 30, county officials said on November 4. Officials, though, were monitoring breakouts further upslope from Pahoa village. None of those breakouts posed any immediate threat, they said. Lava has been pouring out of the volcano since June 27. This aerial footage was shot on Monday, November 3.

stories.title_clean: Fireworks Go Off in UK Fire
stories.clearance_text:

MRSS clients will receive this video via MRSS. Please see emails with the published link.

stories.summary: A fire at a fireworks store in Stafford, United Kingdom, on October 30, injured at least four people and set off a barrage of fireworks, according to media reports. Police and fire officials have not determined what caused the fire. This footage shows the explosions.

stories.title: EBOLA - [PUBLIC] EU Ebola Coordinator Stresses Need for Joint Efforts in West Africa - October 27
stories.title_clean: EU Ebola Coordinator Stresses Need for Joint Efforts in West Africa
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit. {{credit}}
stories.summary: The EU’s newly-appointed Ebola coordinator, Christos Stylianides, said on October 27 that greater, more coordinated efforts were still needed to tackle the Ebola epidemic in West Africa. Stylianides said that, while “the European Union was among the first to respond to the crisis” and had “mobilized over €800 million to fight the epidemic”, the crisis was “putting the entire international community to the test”.
stories.extended_summary:
Stylianides paid tribute to both “local and international humanitarian and health workers who are risking their lives every day.” He said that, of these workers, 443 had contracted the disease and 244 had died.

He said his job was to identify gaps but that coordinated efforts between EU member states were key to hindering the spread of the virus.

Speaking of a potential vaccine for Ebola, Stylianides said the EU had already fast-tracked more than €24m in research funding.
stories.stated_source: YouTube/European Union Humanitarian Aid and Civil Protection

lead_video.owner_name: European Union Humanitarian Aid and Civil Protection

stories.title: Halloween - [EMBED] #Openhappiness Bubbles With Halloween Festivities - October 26
stories.title_clean: #Openhappiness Bubbles With Halloween Festivities
stories.clearance_text: Clients can embed the posts, images and videos in their original form. Embed only. Storyful does not have permissions for downloads and moving any elements within off platform.
stories.summary: The #OpenHappiness hashtag has sparked a wave of Halloween-related posts in October. From Halloween costumes, displays and events users are actively sharing sometimes very creative Coca-Cola inspired moments from their life with their social networks.

stories.title: FRANCE - [CLEARED] Everton Fans Clash With Police in Lille (Photos) - October 23
stories.title_clean: Everton Fans Clash With Police in Lille (Photos)
stories.clearance_text: The copyright owner for the content in this entry has provided clearance for it to be used in broadcasts and online with credit. {{credit}}
stories.summary: Fans of English football team Everton clashed with police in Lille’s Grand Place on October 23, as the top flight side readied for a Europa League match against Lille OSC. Visiting fans became outraged when plain-clothed French police arrested a man, using what some witnesses considered to be excessive use of force, according to reports. Fans reacted by throwing projectiles at police. Riot police responded, firing tear gas canisters.
stories.extended_summary: A journalist for the Liverpool Echo who initially reported that rubber bullets were used later tweeted that the reports were false. The disturbances began at approximately 2:15pm local time. The town’s main square was calm again by 3pm.

stories.title: EBOLA - [CLEARED] Ebola Checks Spark Deadly Riot in Koidu, Sierra Leone - October 21
stories.title_clean: Ebola Checks Spark Deadly Riot in Koidu, Sierra Leone
stories.clearance_text: The copyright owner for the content in this entry has provided clearance for it to be used in broadcasts and online with credit. {{credit}}
stories.summary: Two people were reportedly killed in Koidu, Sierra Leone, on October 21 when a riot broke out after medics attempted to perform tests on an elderly woman suspected of having contracted Ebola. According to local sources, the woman’s son, a local youth leader, refused access and led “gangs” onto the street. Military vehicles are filmed here driving at speed through the town. A curfew was reportedly imposed following the unrest.

stories.title: SOCCER - [CONTACT] Argentina Soccer Brawl Sees 12 Red Cards Issued - October 15
stories.title_clean: Argentina Soccer Brawl Sees 12 Red Cards Issued
stories.clearance_text: We have contacted the uploader of this content to ascertain usage rights. Contact details for the uploader are provided should you wish to contact them directly. We will amend this entry once we have more information.
stories.summary: An Argentine soccer game turned into a mass brawl on October 15 in Rio Negro. Twelve players were issued red cards – and expelled from the field – during a match involving host Deportivo Roca and rivals Cipolletti in Group One of Torneo Federal A, Argentina’s third-tier league.

stories.title: CHINA - [EMBED] Netizen Steals Spotlight From President Xi With Selfie - October 15
stories.title_clean: Netizen Steals Spotlight From President Xi With Selfie
stories.clearance_text: Clients can embed the posts, images and videos in their original form. Embed only. Storyful does not have permissions for downloads and moving any elements within off platform.
stories.summary: A Chinese author has drawn amused reactions from the country’s biggest online community after posting a selfie with President Xi Jinping. Zhou Xiaoping posted the image on Weibo with the tagline: “My mom said when you’re doing a selfie, the worst thing is someone stealing the spotlight!” The photo was taken at an event the president was hosting with authors in Beijing on October 15 to discuss the future direction of Chinese literature.
stories.extended_summary: According to state news agency Xinhua, President Xi personally greeted Zhou and told him: “I hope you guys create more great works that pass the positive energy.” The selfie drew the attention of some reporters working for Western media outlets, who described it as a difficult shot to get.
stories.stated_location: Great Hall of the People, Beijing

stories.title: DRC - [CONTACT] (Photos) Journalist Docments Effects of Fighting in Eastern Congo - October 04 (GRAPHIC)
stories.title_clean: (Photos) Journalist Docments Effects of Fighting in Eastern Congo
stories.clearance_text: The photojournalist has more photos and videos. Permission should be sought from the photojournalist to use these in any media reports. Contact details are provided.
stories.guidance_text: Content in this entry contains images of a graphic nature that viewers may find distressing.
stories.summary: Below is a photo series sent to Storyful by journalist Dearbhla Glynn who is in Beni, eastern DR Congo, near the front line between the ADF rebel group (briefing here the Congolese armed forces, FARDC. Glynn is documenting the fallout from the heavy fighting between these groups, and the trial for the murder of Colonel Mamadou Ndala, described as a “true hero” of Congo, who was murdered on the January 2, 2014.
stories.extended_summary:
Glynn writes: "Fighting has been happening for months between the ADF / NALU rebel group from Rwanda and the FARDC; many soldiers have been killed.

Although the FARDC are carrying out operations against the ADF, the forest makes for a dangerous and difficult terrain, there is no official front line, they are attacked by surprise, and many are being killed. Since the deaths of the strategic and capable Colonel Mamadou and General Bauma, the FARDC are in a weakened position; the army that Col. Mamadou fought hard to train, educate and strengthen, has fallen back into the old patterns of looting and raping.

“The ADF are also killing civilians using machetes and there are reports that over 600 women have been kidnapped over time and taken to a location(s) in the forest. I interviewed one 16 year old girl who escaped yesterday – she says she had been kept as a sex slave for a year. Another girl I interviewed was kept for two years and also used as a sex slave – she’s 12 (photo below).

Little is known about the ADF/Nalu they do not talk to the FARDC or any media, they are not fighting for terrain or mineral wealth, which makes their apparent growth and strength even more ominous. The main leader is Jamil Mukulu he is said to be 68 years old and originally from Uganda.

stories.title: COMPETITION - [EMBED] Mercedes-Benz Celebrates 1M Instagram Followers - September 17
stories.title_clean: Mercedes-Benz Celebrates 1M Instagram Followers
stories.clearance_text: Clients can embed the posts, images and videos in their original form. Embed only. Storyful does not have permissions for downloads and moving any elements within off platform.
stories.summary:
The carmaker races ahead to over 1 million Instagram followers and celebrated by premiering a multi-media art piece by Indian artist Amshu Chukki, featuring the CLS against the Alps.

The automaker’s aggressive use of social media was noted at Advertising Week in NYC in October, with Mercedes claiming it’s the first to try simultaneous Facebook and Instagram promos which boosted traffic by 54%.
stories.extended_summary:
The GM of marketing, Eric Jillard, said of the goal of their use of social media was to “break through and get engagement from our audience.’” In another interview he pronounced that Instagram has become the place where we launch our cars.

The company detailed the positive results from their creative use of the #thingsorganizedneatly tag in this release from Instagram. The tag they selected is a long-standing Instagram tag that already had its own tumblr.

stories.title: BAHRAIN - [PUBLIC] Bahraini Activist Nabeel Rajab Detained for 'Insulting' Tweet - October 01
stories.title_clean: Bahraini Activist Nabeel Rajab Detained for 'Insulting' Tweet
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit. {{credit}}
stories.summary: Nabeel Rajab, a Bahraini human rights activist and an outspoken critic of Bahrain’s government, was detained by authorities on Wednesday, October 1, less than a day after returning from an overseas advocacy trip. Rajab was arrested for insulting a public institution on Twitter. At a hearing on October 2, Rajab was detained for a further seven days while the case is being investigated.
stories.extended_summary:
This footage, posted to Nabeel Rajab’s Facebook page on October 1, was captured of Rajab moments before he arrived at the investigations department. Speaking to the camera, he says, “We’re at the gates of the investigations department, I don’t know what the accusation is, whether I’ll leave again today or not, a month, two months, a year, ten years, but of course none of that matters to me; I insist fully to continue my path and the journey.”

In May 2014, Rajab was released from prison having served two years for his outspoken criticism of the government. During a recent visit to Ireland, Rajab said he feared that he would be rearrested upon his return to the country. Fellow activist Maryam al-Khawaja was detained on entering the country in September.

stories.title: ISLAMIC STATE - [PUBLIC] US Airstrikes Hit Islamic State Targets in Eastern Syria - September 26
stories.title_clean: US Airstrikes Hit Islamic State Targets in Eastern Syria
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided (by an NGO/activist/public body) for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit. {{credit}}
stories.summary: US Central Command confirmed on September 26 that coalition warplanes carried out three airstrikes on Islamic State targets near the eastern city of Deir Ezzor. The UK-based monitoring group Syrian Observatory for Human Rights reported through local sources that the strikes hit the outskirts of the IS-held city of Mayadin, near Deir Ezzor.
stories.extended_summary: Local media activists who share news from the area posted video and photo showing three columns of smoke rising in the aftermath of the strikes. The assault follows previous US airstrikes in Mayadin, which hit Islamic State militants at a modular oil refinery on September 24.

contacts.name: U.S. Central Command
contacts.location: 7115 South Boundary Boulevard MacDill AFB, FL
contacts.notes: U.S. Central Command promotes cooperation among nations

stories.title: BASEBALL - [EMBED] Derek Jeter's Cutest Fans Say Farewell - September 25
stories.title_clean: Derek Jeter's Cutest Fans Say Farewell
stories.clearance_text: Clients can embed the posts, images and videos in their original form. Embed only. Storyful does not have permissions for downloads and moving any elements within off platform.
stories.summary: Ahead of baseball legend Derek Jeter’s last game in Yankee Stadium on September 25, many fans are posting their farewells to the captain on social media. Several Yankee supporters are posting some ‘throwback Thursdays’ to when they were children, wearing the signature Yankee blue. Others posted more recent photos of their children and younger relatives that have become fans of Jeter.

stories.title: DISNEY - [EMBED] Sexy 'Frozen' Costumes Met With Outrage - September 25
stories.title_clean: Sexy 'Frozen' Costumes Met With Outrage
stories.clearance_text: Clients can embed the posts, images and videos in their original form. Embed only. Storyful does not have permissions for downloads and moving any elements within off platform.
stories.summary: The lingerie company responsible for the sexy pizza Halloween costume has done it again – this time managing to create a sexy snowman. The costume can be seen on the Yandy website alongside the ‘Ice Queen’ and ‘Norwegian Maiden’ outfits. All three look remarkably like Olaf, Elsa and Anna from Disney’s Frozen, and are causing a stir on social media.

stories.title: ISLAMIC STATE - [PUBLIC] US Targets Islamic State Site Near Deir Ezzor - September 24
stories.title_clean: US Targets Islamic State Site Near Deir Ezzor
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided (by an NGO/activist/public body) for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit. {{credit}}
stories.summary: The US military conducted a second wave of airstrikes targeting various Islamic State strongholds in Syria on September 24, following the shelling of a number of IS facilities on September 23. This video posted to an account titled “Coordinator Free Euphrates” showing flames and a large explosion is described as showing the moment US airstrikes hit the city of Mayadin, on the outskirts of Deir Ezzor, near the Iraqi border.
stories.extended_summary:
The video was removed from YouTube. A raw copy can be viewed here and copy on YouTube is below.

Deir Ezzor, and Mayadin in particular, is reported to hold a number of IS facilities. Reports also emerged that the US airstrikes are causing civilian deaths and injuries, as well as damage to civilian infrastructure.

stories.title: US - [CONTACT] Ohio Police Release Footage of Controversial Walmart Shooting - August 05
stories.title_clean: Ohio Police Release Footage of Controversial Walmart Shooting
stories.clearance_text: We have contacted the uploader of this content to ascertain usage rights. Contact details for the uploader are provided should you wish to contact them directly. We will amend this entry once we have more information.
stories.summary: Footage was released on September 24 of the August 5 shooting death of John Crawford III by police in Beavercreek, Ohio. The video surfaced the same day that a special grand jury decided not to indict the officers involved in the shooting, which took place in a Walmart while Crawford, a young black man, was walking through the store with a toy gun.
stories.extended_summary: According to a statement by the Ohio Attorney General’s office, the U.S. Justice Department will review the shooting. Surveillance footage of the shooting was released directly to the media during a press briefing on September 24. A local news version of the clip can be seen below. In the video, Crawford can be seen casually swinging the plastic toy gun before dropping it and appearing to fall to the ground before police run towards him with weapons drawn.

contacts.name: WHIO
contacts.notes: Local news station based in Dayton. Ohio.

stories.title: TEST - [NO REPLY] A Public Story
stories.title_clean: A Public Story
stories.clearance_text: We have contacted the uploader of this content to ascertain usage rights. We will update this entry once we have more information.

stories.title: SYRIA - [PUBLIC] Warplanes Bomb Kafr Nabl - September 12
stories.title_clean: Warplanes Bomb Kafr Nabl
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided (by an NGO/activist/public body) for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit. {{credit}}
stories.summary: Several sources based in Kafr Nabl, Idlib province, reported on September 12 that Syrian warplanes bombed the northern town three times in 15 minutes. The Idlib News Network reported that six people were wounded in the bombings and one was brought to Turkey for treatment. The bombings were filmed by local media activists. The restive region around Kafr Nabl has long been targeted by the Syrian regime.

stories.title: PISTORIUS - Live Stream of Oscar Pistorius Trial
stories.title_clean: Live Stream of Oscar Pistorius Trial
stories.summary: Watch live as Judge Masipa delivers her verdict on whether ‘Bladerunner’ Oscar Pistorius is guilty of the manslaughter of his girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp when he shot and killed her at his home on Valentine’s Day, 2013. Pistorius has been acquitted of murder.

stories.title: MH17 - [CONTACT] Third Group of MH17 Passengers' Remains Returned to Malaysia - September 02
stories.title_clean: Third Group of MH17 Passengers' Remains Returned to Malaysia
stories.clearance_text:
The copyright owner for the content in this entry has provided clearance for it to be used in broadcasts and online with credit.
Credit: www.astroawani.com

A note from uploader on use: Please ensure that the Logo (Astro AWANI) of our Video Footage is not blurred. There should be a clear courtesy bug below our logo that must be carried out by all who use this Video. Also, clear credit needs to be given to our Website (www.astroawani.com) from which the video has been taken.
stories.summary: The bodies of a third group of MH17 victims were returned to Malaysia on Tuesday, September 2. A minute’s silence was observed on the tarmac of Kuala Lumpur International Airport after the plane touched down. Nine bodies, including those of seven Malaysians and two Dutch citizens, were received by a honour guard from the Malaysian Armed Forces. The remains of the Malaysian victims were then transported to their respective home states.
stories.extended_summary: Malaysia Airlines Flight MH17 was shot down over eastern Ukraine on 17 July killing its 298 passengers and crew.

stories.title: US-SC - [PUBLIC] US Coast Guard Rescue Passengers From Grounded Casino Boat - July 16
stories.title_clean: US Coast Guard Rescue Passengers From Grounded Casino Boat
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided (by an NGO/activist/public body) for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit. {{credit}}
stories.summary:
A US Coast Guard aircrew from Air Station Savannah transferred 118 people from a grounded casino ship in the Calibogue Sound, off the coast of South Carolina. The boat, The Escapade, is an 174-foot vessel. The US Coast guard will contract crews to salvage the ship and remove the passengers. This video shows US Coast Guard crew lowering a large cage to a passenger from the ship.

See the US Coast Guard’s website for more information.

stories.title: MYANMAR - [CLEARED] Democratic Voice of Burma Journalist Sentenced to Year in Prison - April 10
stories.title_clean: Democratic Voice of Burma Journalist Sentenced to Year in Prison
stories.clearance_text:
The copyright owner for the content in this entry has provided clearance for it to be used in broadcasts and online with credit. {{credit}}

DVB has also requested that a link to its website be referenced if using this piece. http://www.dvb.no/
stories.summary: Newspapers in Myanmar ran black front pages on April 11 in solidarity with a reporter for the Democratic Voice of Burma (DVB) who was sentenced to one year imprisonment earlier in the week. Zaw Pe was charged with trespassing and disturbing a civil servant after visiting a local education department in Magwe to report on a Japanese funded scholarship program. This footage from DVB shows Zaw Pe being transferred to Thayet prison in Mandalay.

contacts.name: Democratic Voice of Burma
contacts.notes: News agency: must ask for permission for use. Usually happy to allow access

stories.title: SYRIA - [PUBLIC] Dutch Priest Details Siege of Homs - January 21
stories.title_clean: Dutch Priest Details Siege of Homs
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided (by an NGO/activist/public body) for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit. {{credit}}
stories.summary: This video, posted by a local media activist, is described as showing Dutch Jesuit priest Father Frans van der Lugt speaking about the tragic situation in a besieged district of Homs where insurgents are still holding out against the Syrian army. Fr van der Lugt, who has been living in Syria for many decades, corresponded on the siege situation last autumn.

stories.title: Abuses in Jdaidat Artouz: Verifying video from Syria
stories.title_clean: Abuses in Jdaidat Artouz: Verifying video from Syria
stories.summary: Amateur video has become vital in bearing witness to the atrocities being committed daily in the bloody battle for Syria. But given the huge number of graphic videos from Syria emerging on social media, the job of verification has become as essential as it is challenging. On Monday, new footage emerged of what activists claimed was the torture and massacre of Syrians in the town of Jdaidat Artouz. Storyful investigated.

stories.title: SYRIA - [PUBLIC] Munition Linked to Chemical Attack Fired in New Video - November 05
stories.title_clean: Munition Linked to Chemical Attack Fired in New Video
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely.
stories.summary: A new video emerged on the evening of November 5 showing what are described as pro-government forces firing a munition described as being linked to the August 21 attack in eastern Ghouta. The video is described as being captured in the eastern Ghouta region. The description states the rocket’s targets were rebel forces in the Tameco complex near Mleiha. We are discussing this video in Open Newsroom here.

stories.title: SYRIA - [PUBLIC] Footage of alleged chemical attack shown to Senate Intelligence Committee - August 21
stories.title_clean: Footage of alleged chemical attack shown to Senate Intelligence Committee
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit.
stories.summary: Originally uploaded by Damascus media activists, this footage was shown to US Senate Select Committee on Intelligence on Thursday, September 5. The videos collected here are among more than 200 that emerged in the wake of the alleged chemical attack on East Ghouta and Moadimiya on August 21. Available as a YouTube playlist here.

contacts.name: Kafr Batna Coordination Committee
contacts.facebook_name: Coordinating Kafr Batna - Syrian Revolution in Damascus

stories.title: SYRIA - [PUBLIC] Chechen-led foreign fighters claim 'split from Al Qaida' - September 04
stories.title_clean: Chechen-led foreign fighters claim 'split from Al Qaida'
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit.
stories.summary: This video shows a group of more than 40 men identified as fighters for a new group calling itself the Mujahideen of the Caucasus in the Levant. In the video, posted September 3, the group announces its decision to split from the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL). Although ISIL is mentioned in the video, the group is actually an offshoot of the Chechen-led Jaysh al-Muhajirin wal-Ansar. It is likely they were ejected from that grouping.

contacts.name: Mujahideen of the Caucasus in the Levant
contacts.notes: YouTube channel associated with Aleppo-based, Chechen-led, foreign fighter unit

stories.title: SYRIA - [PUBLIC] Zamalka council gives details of East Ghouta attack  - September 03
stories.title_clean: Zamalka council gives details of East Ghouta attack
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit.
stories.summary: While attention was focused on the promised appearance at a press conference in Istanbul of a defector with insider knowledge of Assad’s chemical weapons programme, local opposition organisations from the area at the centre of the August 21 attack on East Ghouta held their own press conference. They gave further details of that attack and its aftermath to a group of video-linked journalists in Turkey.

contacts.name: The National Coalition for Syrian Revolutionary and Opposition Forces (SNC)
contacts.notes: Opposition umbrella group. Better known as Syrian National Coalition (SNC)

stories.title: SYRIA - [PUBLIC] Geolocation of alleged chemical rockets in East Ghouta - August 28
stories.title_clean: Geolocation of alleged chemical rockets in East Ghouta
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit.
stories.summary: Initial reports of the chemical attack in Damascus on August 21 were non-specific in detailing where it struck. Most simply mentioned ‘East Ghouta’, a swathe of farmland and suburbs flanking the city. We tracked back through early Facebook posts by local activists and found that the most consistent references were to the adjoining neighbourhoods of Ein Tarma and Zamalka. Geolocated videos now support this analysis.

stories.title: SYRIA - [PUBLIC] Firing of missile similar to 'chemical weapons rockets' - August 21
stories.title_clean: Firing of missile similar to 'chemical weapons rockets'
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely.
stories.summary: This video, posted by media activists associated with Daraya, south of Damascus, shows a missile similar to those found at the site of an alleged chemical weapons incident in eastern Ghouta (and reportedly in Adra, Damascus, amid similar claims) being fired. The daytime video is unlikely to be directly linked to the alleged chemical weapons (CW) attack, which took place around 0230 local time (at night).

stories.title: SYRIA - [PUBLIC] Activists Visit Site of Alleged Chemical Attack in Zamalka - August 27
stories.title_clean: Activists Visit Site of Alleged Chemical Attack in Zamalka
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit.
stories.summary: These videos, posted by a user associated with the southern Damascus suburb of Kfar Sousa on August 27, are said to show the aftermath of the alleged chemical weapons attack in eastern Ghouta. They are all tagged as being from Zamalka. Storyful has used and verified videos from this uploader in the past; they can be seen here.

contacts.name: Coordinating the Syrian Revolution in Kfar Sousa
contacts.facebook_name: Coordinating the Syrian revolution in Kvrsush
contacts.notes: Posting from a suburb of Damascus

stories.title: Alleged CW Attacks - Geography, Chronology
stories.title_clean: Alleged CW Attacks - Geography, Chronology

stories.title: IVORY COAST - [UPDATED] Analysis of 2011 Abobo massacre  - March 03 (GRAPHIC)
stories.title_clean: [UPDATED] Analysis of 2011 Abobo massacre
stories.summary: The following is an investigation into the video above, described as the shooting dead of at least six women by security forces (FDS) loyal to Laurent Gbagbo during a protest in Abobo on March 3, 2011. The video shows unarmed women chanting “ADO” (Alassane Dramane Ouattara), when (at 3:32) armoured personnel carriers come into view and large calibre rounds are fired. Several people appear to be fatally wounded.

stories.title: Syrian slaughter: Investigating alleged war crimes via social media
stories.title_clean: Syrian slaughter: Investigating alleged war crimes via social media
stories.summary: Video emerged on November 1 which appeared to show a group of prisoners being summarily executed. As we monitored the conversation on social media, there were claims that the video showed Free Syrian Army fighters executing prisoners belonging to the Syrian army. The flurry of activity appeared to have been prompted by the posting of the video to a YouTube channel linked to the UK-based Syrian Observatory for Human Rights.

stories.title: Outcry as Turkey drops Sivas massacre prosecutions
stories.title_clean: Outcry as Turkey drops Sivas massacre prosecutions
stories.summary: The case against four people accused in connection with an infamous 1993 massacre in Turkey was dropped on Tuesday amid protests outside Ankara’s 11th High Criminal Court. The court agreed with defence lawyers that the statute of limitations meant the case had expired.

stories.title: VIDEO: UN observers film shelling of Homs
stories.title_clean: VIDEO: UN observers film shelling of Homs
stories.summary: UN observers in Syria have released a video of the devastation being wrought on the city of Homs and its environs. In this video, uploaded on the UNSMIS account (United Nations Supervision Mission In Syria), smoke can be seen rising from buildings hit by shells. The observers then travel to Talbiseh and al-Rastan north of Homs, witnessing the aftermath of destruction. One man asks why nobody will help. “We are people,” he says. “Not animals.”

stories.title: SYRIA - [PUBLIC] Turning night into day: analysis of where air strikes blamed on Israel hit - May 05
stories.title_clean: Turning night into day: analysis of where air strikes blamed on Israel hit
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry contains video provided by activists and Syrian state media (SANA) - these are provided for public dissemination and may be rebroadcast. One video used in our analysis is provided by the Lebanese network Al Manar, who should be contacted for rebroadcast rights. Credits are provided beneath each video and item of content below.
stories.summary: The appearance of video showing a dramatic night-time air strike on Damascus, on May 5, presented an opportunity to demonstrate the power of geolocation and to answer, with precision, one pertinent question: Where did it hit?

stories.title: Verifying video from Baida 'massacre'
stories.title_clean: Verifying video from Baida 'massacre'
stories.summary: On May 2, 2013, Syrian army troops and militia men entered the coastal village of Baida, in Tartous province, conducting operations in neighbouring Banias the next day in what was described as a strike against armed terrorists.

stories.title: US - [NO REPLY] Dzhokhar Tsarnaev profiles - April 19
stories.title_clean: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev profiles
stories.clearance_text: We have contacted the uploader of this content to ascertain usage rights. We will update this entry once we have more information.
stories.summary: It is officially CONFIRMED that Dzhokhar Tsarnaev is suspect 2 in the Boston Marathon bombing. Below, we are assembling social media and online proviles of Dzokhar. Links to the original are beneath each shot. The July 22 date of birth on the file sheet below matches that on his vk.com profile.

stories.title: LIVE: Funeral for Margaret Thatcher
stories.title_clean: LIVE: Funeral for Margaret Thatcher

stories.title: Papal Inauguration: Live Coverage
stories.title_clean: Papal Inauguration: Live Coverage
stories.summary: Follow a live feed from Rome below, along with our curated Twitter list:

stories.title: SYRIA - [CONTACT] RPG Hit on Tank in Daraya Seen From Both Sides - March 11 (DRAMATIC)
stories.title_clean: RPG Hit on Tank in Daraya Seen From Both Sides
stories.clearance_text: We have contacted the uploader of the ANNA content here to ascertain usage rights. Contact details for ANNA are provided should you wish to contact them directly. We will amend this entry once we have more information. The second video in this entry is provided by an activist body for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit.
stories.summary: These videos show an attack on a Syrian army tank in Daraya, Damascus, on March 6, from two distinct viewpoints; from a trailing tank and from behind the insurgent fighter who fired a rocket-propelled grenade to destroy it.

contacts.name: ANNA News
contacts.notes: Provide videos from Russia and Ukraine, specifically on Russia's national security.

stories.title: BAHRAIN - [PUBLIC] Human rights activist looks back at the 2011 uprising - February 11
stories.title_clean: Human rights activist looks back at the 2011 uprising
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit.
stories.summary: Two weeks before the 2nd anniversary of the 14 February popular uprising in Bahrain, and just after her return to Bahrain after almost two years, Human rights activist Maryam Al-Khawaja sat down for an interview with Front Line Defenders.

contacts.name: Jim Loughran
contacts.title: Communications director
contacts.notes: Trying to get Irish delegation to Bahrain as Khawaja hunger strike hits 50 days.

stories.title: VIRAL - [CONTACT] Canadian Animation Students Claim Responsibility for Fake Eagle Video - December 18
stories.title_clean: Canadian Animation Students Claim Responsibility for Fake Eagle Video
stories.clearance_text: We have contacted the uploader of this content to ascertain usage rights. Contact details for the uploader are provided should you wish to contact them directly. We will amend this entry once we have more information.
stories.summary: The video widely circulated online on December 19 of an eagle attempting to snatch a baby in Montreal became a viral sensation. It has clocked up over 1 million views in one day. However, not long after it was posted, the online community began to realize that it was a fake, and by the end of the day a group of animation students from Montreal claimed responsibility for the very professional fake. See their statement here.

contacts.name: Claude Arsenault
contacts.title: Manager, Communications and Public Relations
contacts.notes: Offers 3D animation and digital design degree, claimed ownership of viral 'Golden Eagle' video

stories.title: SYRIA - [PUBLIC] BRIEFING: US accuses Syria of firing Scud missiles  - December 12
stories.title_clean: BRIEFING: US accuses Syria of firing Scud missiles
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided (by an NGO/activist/public body) for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit.
stories.summary: An unnamed US official has told the New York Times that more than six long-range Scud missiles were fired from Damascus at targets in the north of the country in recent days. Please note the image is a file photograph for illustration only.

stories.title: SYRIA - [PUBLIC] Houla: 'Akrab witnesses in field hospital' - December 11
stories.title_clean: Houla: 'Akrab witnesses in field hospital'
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided (by an NGO/activist/public body) for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit.
stories.summary: These videos are said to show injured persons at a field hospital in Houla, rural Homs. The video descriptions are patchy but, with reference to a Facebook page associated with anti-Assad media activists from Houla, the picture being presented by that side becomes clearer. The people in the video are said to have been injured or otherwise involved in a complex incident in Akrab (see below). Right now, all information from there is second-hand.

stories.title: BAHRAIN - [PUBLIC] International human rights defenders provide character references for Rajab - December 10
stories.title_clean: International human rights defenders provide character references for Rajab
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided (by an NGO/activist/public body) for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit.
stories.summary: Videos of international human rights defenders’ personal testimonies in support of President of the Bahrain Center for Human Rights Nabeel Rajab were uploaded to the YouTube channel of Rajab’s wife on December 10. The videos were published ahead of the final hearing of his appeal against a three year sentence for “inciting hatred”. The character references were sent to the court, describing Rajab as a peaceful human rights activist.

stories.title: SYRIA - [PUBLIC] Video purports to show execution - November 29 (GRAPHIC)
stories.title_clean: Video purports to show execution
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided (by an NGO/activist/public body) for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit.
stories.summary:
WARNING: Video unverified as yet, providing as FYI. Adding details below
The video above is described as the execution of prisoners by members of the Islamist rebel group Jabhat al-Nusra. It was uploaded to YouTube on November 29 but it may relate to events in the middle of November. The location is thought to be Ras al-Ayn (Sri Canet), but this is unconfirmed. It does not appear to be the main border crossing but a location outside the city.

stories.title: SYRIA - [PUBLIC] Rebels claim to have captured SAM site near Aleppo - November 28
stories.title_clean: Rebels claim to have captured SAM site near Aleppo
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided (by an NGO/activist/public body) for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit.
stories.summary: This edited video, uploaded by a media-savvy Syrian rebel formation called Ahrar al-Sham, is said to show the liberation of an air base at Al Muntar Air in rural Aleppo. The installation appears to be a small surface-to-air missile site comprising a radar station and several SAMs. During the video a missile is seen being fired, perhaps to stop it falling into rebel hands, in a dramatic segment. Several unfired missiles are seen in rebel hands.

stories.title: EGYPT - [PUBLIC] Investigation into harrassment of Dutch Tourist - January 27
stories.title_clean: Investigation into harrassment of Dutch Tourist
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided (by an NGO/activist/public body) for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely with credit.
stories.summary: Below are our investigations into the video above, reported as the assault of a Dutch tourist by an unruly mob in Cairo on January 27, 2012. The details of this video tally with several people who reported the assault first-hand, and with details provided by Global Post writer Erin Cunningham who reported the incident. One of the eyewitnesses confirmed the identity of the woman filmed above as the Dutch Tourist.

stories.title: SYRIA - [PUBLIC] Video claims to show summary executions by FSA  - November 01
stories.title_clean: Video claims to show summary executions by FSA
stories.clearance_text: The content in this entry is provided by an activist for public dissemination and rebroadcast. It may be used freely.
stories.summary: This video, uploaded on November 1, shows what is claimed to be a summary execution of Syrian army soldiers by members of the Free Syrian Army (FSA). The video shows a group of men on the ground surrounded by armed men. They are seen being beaten, and from 2.21 there are bursts of gunfire and at least one person on the ground is seen being shot. The caption says the incident took place near Saraqib, in Idlib governorate.

stories.title: STORYFUL - Viral Videos for Week of October 21 - October 24
stories.title_clean: Viral Videos for Week of October 21
stories.summary: Viral Videos for week of October 21. For access information to these videos, contact sales@storyful.com or see http://storyful.com/pro

stories.title: Maspero massacre underscores Egypt's unfinished revolution
stories.title_clean: Maspero massacre underscores Egypt's unfinished revolution
stories.summary: Coptic Christians are calling it a massacre. They have declared three days’ mourning. And Cairo is as tense as it was at the height of the revolution. Once more the security forces stand accused of murder after unarmed protesters were shot, beaten, and mowed down in the street. Plainclothes thugs have made a return.

contacts.name: Sharif Kouddous
contacts.notes: Journalist - has dramatic footage from el-Fath mosque

contacts.name: Daily News Egypt / International Herald Tribune
contacts.notes: Egyptian affiliate of International Herald Tribune

stories.title: TEST - [NO REPLY] Embedded Playlist - October 09
stories.title_clean: Embedded Playlist
stories.clearance_text: We have contacted the uploader of this content to ascertain usage rights. We will update this entry once we have more information.
stories.summary: Testing playlist embed.

stories.title: ROMNEY - [NO REPLY] Romney on Iran getting a nuclear bomb if Obama is re-elected
stories.title_clean: Romney on Iran getting a nuclear bomb if Obama is re-elected
stories.clearance_text: We have contacted the uploader of this content to ascertain usage rights. We will update this entry once we have more information.
stories.summary: On March 4, Republican presidential candidate Mitt Romney warned voters in Snellville, Georgia, that Iran would produce a nuclear weapon if President Obama were to be re-elected to a second term. “If Barack Obama gets re-elected, Iran will have a nuclear weapon and the world will change," said Romney. This is an Associated Press video above. Do you have any usage rights with them?

stories.title: Syrian refugees cross border on foot
stories.title_clean: Syrian refugees cross border on foot
stories.summary: This video from the Jordanian daily newspaper Aghad shows refugees crossing into the country from Syria. Fleeing civilians are seen in knots along a mountain road. The beauty of the landscape and the photography is in stark contrast to the plight of the refugees. The photographer is named as Mohammad Abu Ghosh (محمد أبو غوش), and is a staffer for the paper.

stories.title: US POLITICS - RNC counters #47percent with #Redistribution
stories.title_clean: RNC counters #47percent with #Redistribution
stories.summary: In the counter campaign over #47percent, the RNC has responded with #distribution. In an attack ad on September 19, the RNC seized on video of Obama in 1998 in which he seemed to support the idea of wealth distribution. The push back has begun.

contacts.name: Chris Harris, American Bridge 21st Century
contacts.notes: Provided edited video showing Mitt Romney "flipping" on "Race to the Top"

stories.title: Newsweek gets flak for #MuslimRage hashtag
stories.title_clean: Newsweek gets flak for #MuslimRage hashtag
stories.summary: A cover story on Newsweek magazine about protests around the world in response to an anti-Islam film prompted a backlash on Twitter on September 17. The magazine ran a title page with the words ‘Muslim Rage’ emblazoned across it and set out to provoke an online conversation with the hashtag #MuslimRage. Thousands of Muslim and other Twitter users, however, showed what they thought of the hashtag with angry – and humorous – responses.

stories.title: Mexicans storm social media over missing blogger
stories.title_clean: Mexicans storm social media over missing blogger
stories.summary: Mexican activists took to Twitter on Friday looking for information about a popular activist blogger who they claim disappeared earlier this month. According to his own blog, El 5anto, also known as Ruy Salgado, has not been seen since September 8. In June of this year, he claimed the Mexican government was coming for him and asked fans to keep his blog El 5antuario going if he disappeared.

stories.title: Libyans raise their voices against Benghazi violence
stories.title_clean: Libyans raise their voices against Benghazi violence
stories.summary: Libyans both on and offline have been raising their voices to condemn the violence in Benghazi on Tuesday that claimed the lives of four Americans, among them US Ambassador Chris Stevens. The video above is a single statement by a number of Libyans making clear their opposition to the attacks, created in memory of the late ambassador.

stories.title: Online campaign looks to #shutdownthesun
stories.title_clean: Online campaign looks to #shutdownthesun
stories.summary: Irate Twitter users in Britain kicked off an online campaign to shut down the Sun newspaper for its reporting of the 1989 Hillsborough stadium disaster that cost 96 lives. The campaign came after an independent report revealed a police cover-up that falsely blamed fans for the disaster. At the time, the Sun newspaper had reported that Liverpool fans were drunk and urinating on the dead under the frontpage headline “The Truth”.

stories.title: Amateur astronomer films object slamming Jupiter
stories.title_clean: Amateur astronomer films object slamming Jupiter
stories.summary: Amateur astronomer George Hall read a report in an online Jupiter-observing forum about an object hitting Jupiter on September 10. “When I saw the post, I went back and examined the videos that I had collected this morning,” Hall wrote on his night sky photography website that day. At 6:35 a.m. CT, he had indeed captured this video of the spectacular crash on his camera, set up in the middle of Dallas, Texas.

stories.title: Fifteen minutes of infamy: The film that sparked Muslim protests
stories.title_clean: Fifteen minutes of infamy: The film that sparked Muslim protests
stories.summary: A video just under 14-minutes long that has been on YouTube since July 2 sparked protests outside US diplomatic missions in several Arabic countries this week. It claims to be the “trailer” from a movie called “The Real Life of Muhammad” or “Innocence of Muslims.” But it’s been available online for over two months. Why did protests only kick off on Tuesday?

stories.title: Nova Scotia gets wet ahead of tropical storm
stories.title_clean: Nova Scotia gets wet ahead of tropical storm
stories.summary: Tropical Storm Leslie trudged toward Newfoundland on Monday, but the storm’s progress was slowed by another weather front that dumped heavy rains on Nova Scotia, Canada. The floods brought damage and disruption to several towns, including Truro, seen in this video. Dikes along the Salmon River in Truro failed on Monday, spilling water onto streets and into businesses.

stories.title: Anonymous member claims takedown of GoDaddy.com
stories.title_clean: Anonymous member claims takedown of GoDaddy.com
stories.summary: Thousands of web sites became utterly inaccessible on Monday when a Distributed Denial of Service attack targeted GoDaddy.com, not only taking that web site offline but also taking down personal and small business web sites either hosted by GoDaddy or using the company’s DNS services. A single member of Anonymous claimed responsibility for the attack and was completely unsympathetic to GoDaddy users who wanted their sites back.

stories.title: Divided Democrats lose seats in Hong Kong while protests continue
stories.title_clean: Divided Democrats lose seats in Hong Kong while protests continue
stories.summary: Hong Kong’s Democratic Party Chief Albert Ho stepped down on Monday after the party’s poor performance in legislative elections at the weekend. The party won just four seats, down from eight, in the 70-seat assembly. The surprise result comes amid ongoing pro-democracy protests at Central Government offices against the National Education curriculum. Some residents say the curriculum is a plan by Beijing to brainwash Hong Kong children.

stories.title: NIcaraguan volcano spews high column of ash and steam
stories.title_clean: NIcaraguan volcano spews high column of ash and steam
stories.summary: Nicaragua’s San Cristobal volcano spewed a column of steam and ash 2.5 miles into the sky on Saturday, September 8, forcing authorities to evacuate 3,000 people from the area. These videos offer a dramatic look at the eruption backed by clear blue skies.

contacts.name: Henry Ruiz
contacts.notes: Provided video of volcanic eruption in Nicaragua.

stories.title: Crist defection inflames GOP as he hugs it out with Obama
stories.title_clean: Crist defection inflames GOP as he hugs it out with Obama
stories.summary: Supporters of the Republican Party were incensed at former Florida governor Charlie Crist’s defection from the GOP, but his recent cosying up to President Barack Obama has inflamed their ire yet further. Crist spoke in support of Obama at the Democratic National Convention on Thursday, and on Saturday he introduced Obama at a campaign rally in Seminole, Florida. The pair’s embrace at that event was soon the talk of Twitter.

contacts.name: PBSNewsHour
contacts.links:
http://flickr.com/newshour
http://newshour.tumblr.com

Annette Miller, director of research and information services
contacts.notes: This user has pre-cleared their material for use with credit to PBS Newshour.

stories.title: Spaniards tell Merkel they won't pay with #MerkelWirBezahlenNicht
stories.title_clean: Spaniards tell Merkel they won't pay with #MerkelWirBezahlenNicht
stories.summary: Spaniards took to Twitter on Thursday to protest a visit by German Chancellor Angela Merkel as pressure mounted on Spanish Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy to accept a sovereign bailout. But in the wake of deeply unpopular austerity measures, Spaniards had their own message for Merkel, and made it clear with a hashtag in her own language that trended across Spain on Thursday: #MerkelWirBezahlenNicht which translates as ‘Merkel, we won’t pay.’

stories.title: Powerful earthquake strikes Costa Rica
stories.title_clean: Powerful earthquake strikes Costa Rica
stories.summary: When Costa Rica was hit by a 7.6 magnitude earthquake on September 5, this was one of the first videos we found, uploaded to the YouTube channel of La Nacion journalist Damián Arroyo, who is based in San Jose. The video includes swaying poles and wailing sirens. The quake rattled buildings and briefly caused a tsunami alert for the coastline.

stories.title: Flooding from Isaac remains in Louisiana
stories.title_clean: Flooding from Isaac remains in Louisiana
stories.summary: The storm itself is just a memory, but Hurricane Isaac left devastating flooding behind in the bayous and other lower areas of Louisiana. This video was shot near Springfield.

contacts.name: Stephen Spell
contacts.notes: Has video of Hurricane Isaac aftermath

stories.title: Activists film bombing of Al Bab as it unfolds
stories.title_clean: Activists film bombing of Al Bab as it unfolds
stories.summary: Several YouTube videos uploaded by activists working in the northern Syrian town of Al Bab show the aerial bombardment of Al Bab by regime warplanes on Monday. The videos are a rare instance of near real-time filming of an atrocity carried out by the Syrian regime. Dozens of people were killed when at least three bombs were dropped by warplanes on September 3. More were buried beneath the rubble of collapsed buildings, local sources said.

contacts.name: Al Bab Local Coordinating Committee
contacts.notes: Also uses videos from this account: http://www.youtube.com/user/AlbabCityShbab/videos

contacts.name: Bzaa Revolution
contacts.notes: Local activist uploading video from Bzaa and Al Bab

stories.title: National Empty Chair Day takes hold after Clint's RNC performance
stories.title_clean: National Empty Chair Day takes hold after Clint's RNC performance
stories.summary: The fallout from Clint Eastwood’s address at the Republican National Convention (RNC) continued on Monday when conservatives celebrated what they called “National Empty Chair Day.” Eastwood addressed the RNC on its final night accompanied by an empty chair, meant to represent President Obama. Twitter duly lit up with responses, many comical, with the hashtag #Eastwooding trending.

tags.label: GOP
tags.description: The latest videos, photos and social content from the Republican Party on the campaign trail.

stories.title: An unusual Q&A on the Romney plane
stories.title_clean: An unusual Q&A on the Romney plane
stories.summary: It wasn’t the standard way to get an answer to a question, but at least the reporters got it in writing. NBC reporter Peter Alexander rolled an orange down the aisle of Mitt Romney’s campaign plane on Saturday. Written on the fruit was a question asking the GOP presidential candidate if Ohio Sen. Rob Portman would play President Obama in his debate preparations. “Shh!” Romney wrote on the return roll. “Don’t tell Sununu! But yes.”

contacts.name: Kasie Hunt
contacts.notes: Pool video of Romney's orange bowl

stories.title: Coast Guard helicopter comes to the rescue
stories.title_clean: Coast Guard helicopter comes to the rescue
stories.summary: Louisiana saw several helicopter rescues, like this one in LaPlace, because of the severe flooding from Hurricane Isaac. Here, a Coast Guard helicopter pulls someone up to safety in the town west of New Orleans.

contacts.name: Jonathan Betz
contacts.notes: Reporter with WFAA (ABC affiliate) covering Hurricane Isaac in Louisiana

stories.title: Girl rescued from brothel sends video message to journalist
stories.title_clean: Girl rescued from brothel sends video message to journalist
stories.clearance_text: The copyright owner for the content in this entry has provided clearance for it to be rebroadcast across any media freely with appropriate credit to the YouTube/Somaly Mam Foundation.
stories.summary: A dramatic live-tweeting of a brothel raid in Cambodia which captured the world’s attention last year has finally come full circle. On August 30, New York Times journalist Nicholas Kristof posted a video update he had received from one of the girls he witnessed being rescued while documenting the story. The brutal story and description of the young victims in Kristof’s live Twitter account exposed the brothel’s trafficking of underage girls.

stories.title: Paralympic Games kick off in London
stories.title_clean: Paralympic Games kick off in London
stories.summary: As the Paralympic Games began on August 29 with an opening ceremony in London’s Olympic Stadium, the city once again came alive with competitive energy. The event marked the beginning of 11 days of athletic competitions in the city, with almost 4,200 athletes from around the world taking part. The energy is evident in videos of the ceremony, such as the one above which shows the crowd’s reaction to Team Great Britain entering the stadium.

stories.title: Streets run red after La Tomatina Festival
stories.title_clean: Streets run red after La Tomatina Festival
stories.summary: The annual La Tomatina festival took place in Buñol, Spain on August 29, bringing almost 40,000 revelers to the small town west of Valencia to participate in the traditional tomato throwing celebration. The event is held on the last Wednesday of August during a week of festivities and has been held since 1943. This year’s participants were quick to post videos and images of the festival in all of its glory.

stories.title: Hurricane Isaac makes waves on Lake Pontchartrain
stories.title_clean: Hurricane Isaac makes waves on Lake Pontchartrain
stories.summary: Isaac reached hurricane status on Tuesday morning and made landfall in the early evening on the Louisiana coast while its strong outer bands of tropical storm force winds pounded Mississippi, Alabama and the Florida panhandle. These videos shows strong winds and waves pounding the shore at Lake Pontchartrain in New Orleans as the eye of the storm came ashore in extreme southeastern Louisiana.

contacts.name: Charles Walton
contacts.notes: Filmed videos of Hurricane Isaac pounding New Orleans' Lake Pontchartrain

stories.title: Christie's Greatest Hits: A round up of his best YouTube moments
stories.title_clean: Christie's Greatest Hits: A round up of his best YouTube moments
stories.summary: Ahead of his keynote address at the Republican National Convention in Tampa, Florida, tonight, we have compiled New Jersey Governor Chris Christie’s greatest hits in one easy-to-manage page. No stranger to the limelight, Christie has shot to prominence in the Republican Party since becoming New Jersey’s governor in 2009, particularly for his hardline stance on public expenditure.

tags.label: Chris Christie
tags.description: The latest videos, photos and social content from Gov. Chris Christie’s campaign for U.S. president.

tags.label: GOP
tags.description: The latest videos, photos and social content from the Republican Party on the campaign trail.

stories.title: Typhoon Bolaven slams South Korea
stories.title_clean: Typhoon Bolaven slams South Korea
stories.summary: As Hurricane Isaac took aim at New Orleans, Typhoon Bolaven barreled into the Korean peninsula, putting the Seoul, South Korea, under a typhoon warning. Outside of the capital, the storm’s outer bands were already dumping heavy rain in parts of the country. Monday night, strong winds battered Gwangju, as seen in this video from Jason Morrow, out in the storm.

contacts.name: Byung Wook Jung
contacts.notes: Added footage of Typhoon Bolaven in August 2012

stories.title: Google Crisis Response Map charts progress of Isaac
stories.title_clean: Google Crisis Response Map charts progress of Isaac
stories.summary:
As Tropical Storm, expected to become Hurricane, Isaac made its way from the Caribbean to the coast of Florida and onwards towards the southern coast of Louisiana, Alabama, and Mississippi, all eyes were on the region.

Storyful was busy verifying and geo-tagging videos from the affected areas.

stories.title: Protests proceed in Tampa despite Republican convention delay
stories.title_clean: Protests proceed in Tampa despite Republican convention delay
stories.summary: Tampa is a hive of activity on August 27, but not for the reasons the Republican Party would have liked. Tropical Storm Isaac battered the Florida Keys forcing the GOP to delay its convention by one day. But that hasn’t stopped the many protesters from hitting the streets. The causes vary, from Dogs Against Romney to women dressed as vaginas. Isaac is expected to grow to hurricane strength but Republicans insist the show will start on Tuesday.

tags.label: GOP
tags.description: The latest videos, photos and social content from the Republican Party on the campaign trail.

contacts.name: Robert L. Beukema
contacts.notes: Photojournalist added footage of Tropical Storm Debby June 2012, happy to clear any footage added to YouTube for use.

stories.title: RNC in the eye of the storm
stories.title_clean: RNC in the eye of the storm
stories.summary:
Anticipation is building in Tampa, Florida for the Republican National Convention (RNC) next week. But all the preparations could be unhinged as organizers struggle to keep up with weather alerts, with tropical storm Isaac making its way towards Florida.

The photo above, taken by David M. Drucker of Roll Call shows a calm Tampa on Saturday morning.

tags.label: GOP
tags.description: The latest videos, photos and social content from the Republican Party on the campaign trail.

contacts.name: Robert L. Beukema
contacts.notes: Photojournalist added footage of Tropical Storm Debby June 2012, happy to clear any footage added to YouTube for use.

stories.title: Tropical Storm Isaac enters the Caribbean at Martinique
stories.title_clean: Tropical Storm Isaac enters the Caribbean at Martinique
stories.summary: Tropical Storm Isaac passed by Martinique as it entered the Caribbean on Wednesday, August 22. This video offers some of the first images of the storm as its powerful waves slammed near the Fort de France Martinique.

contacts.name: Miguel Don
contacts.notes: Filmed video of Tropical Storm Isaac bashing waves on Martinique
